meanings.definition: To place in a line or bring into alignment.
meanings.sent1: She was alining the books neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The students were alining themselves for the class photo.
meanings.sent3: The ducks were alining in a perfect row, ready to march.
meanings.sent4: The stars alining in the night sky created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The workers alining the bricks made the building look symmetrical.

meanings.definition: To adjust or arrange in a straight line.
meanings.sent1: He was alining the picture frame on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was alining the flower pots along the path.
meanings.sent3: The ants were alining in a straight line, following each other.
meanings.sent4: The cars alining on the road made the traffic flow smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The tailor was alining the fabric before cutting it for the dress.

meanings.definition: To position or arrange in a straight line.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were alining themselves for the parade.
meanings.sent2: She was alining the pencils neatly on the desk.
meanings.sent3: The trees were alining perfectly along the path, creating a natural tunnel.
meanings.sent4: The planets alining in the solar system was a rare sight.
meanings.sent5: The workers were alining the boxes in the warehouse for easy access.
